newsitem.title: GERMANY: Buba calls for lasting fight against inflation.
newsitem.headline: Buba calls for lasting fight against inflation.

text.p: The Bundesbank on Tuesday said the struggle against inflation should be an enduring goal of central banks worldwide.

In its December monthly report, the German central bank said the recent fall in global capital market rates proved that central banks were paying sufficient attention to the need to keep inflation down.

"At the same time it remains important, especially at a time of low inflation, to take on the need to suppress inflation as a permanent task and not to allow any doubts to arise about the stability-oriented nature of monetary policy," the report said.
Central bank efforts to promote short-term economic growth because of the current low inflation rates "ignore the lasting character of the stability task," the Bundesbank said.
Such an approach also raises the risk of speculative turbulence on financial markets because of investors' insecurity, the Bundesbank added.
